paint.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a liquid that you put on a surface, using a brush to make the surface a particular colour
paint.translation[0].definitions[0].note: peeling/flaking paint (=old paint that is starting to come off the surface)
paint.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Wet paint  (=used as a warning on signs when something has just been painted)
The whole house could do with a fresh coat of paint.
All this room needs is a lick of paint (=paint used to make a place more attractive).
paint.translation[0].note_box[0].section: a can/tin/pot of paint
He had spilt a can of paint on the floor.
a tube of paint
There was a painting on one of the easels and a table with his brushes and tubes of paint.
a layer of paint
They removed the old layers of paint.
a coat of paint
Walls usually need at least two coats of paint.
a lick of paint
All she needed to do to the kitchen was give it a lick of paint.
white/red/blue etc
I decided to use white paint throughout the house.
Careful – the paint is still wet.
Remove the tape when the paint is dry.
The place smelled of fresh paint and new carpets.
peeling/flaking paint
She lived in a gloomy old building with peeling paint on the walls.
put paint on something
Don’t put the paint on too thick.
apply paint
Clean the surface before applying the paint with a brush or roller.
spray paint
Vandals had sprayed paint all over the walls.
strip paint
We decided to strip the paint off the doors.
scrape off/away paint
Scrape off any loose or flaking paint and rub the surface with sandpaper.
paint dries
Wait for the paint to dry.
paint peels/flakes
The paint was starting to peel off the window frame.
paint.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to put paint on a surface
paint.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Paint the walls in a contrasting colour.
The living room was painted in pastel shades of pink and blue.
paint.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to make a picture, design etc using paint
paint.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: A white cross was painted on the door.
Turner is famous for painting landscapes.
paint.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to put a coloured substance on part of your face or body to make it different or more attractive
paint.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: The children’s faces were painted to look like animals.
She’d painted her toenails with red nail polish.
paint.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: to describe someone or something in a particular way
paint.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: The article painted him in a bad light (=described him in a way that made him seem bad).
Dickens painted a grim picture of Victorian life.
paint a grim/rosy/gloomy picture of somebody/something
She’s often been painted as a tough businesswoman.
